fields.description:
When I attempt to connect GitHub account thru SSH, I am pointed to this URL which does not re-direct back to Sourcetree. I have manually added the SSH key and am still unable to authenticate.

!Screenshot 2018-12-28 11.11.09.png!

 

!Screenshot 2018-12-28 11.12.08.png!

 

!Screenshot 2018-12-28 11.12.45.png!
fields.summary: GitHub Auth re-direct 404

fields.description:
The following URI shows the requirements to edit a commit message.

[https://help.github.com/articles/changing-a-commit-message]

 

Can this be made into a function of Sourcetree?

I have looked through all the menu and also through the backlog and have been unable to find the feature - or a previous request for it.
fields.summary: Add ability to edit previously pushed commit messages

fields.description:
Launching External Merge tool for file that has been removed on remote and modified on local (or vice versa) doesn't do anything. 

 

Anyway can't enter bug so I've entered this as improvement.
fields.summary: BUG:

fields.description:
In our office, this seems to start to be an issue.
Not sure if that was planned, but you will probably see your user base drop dramatically if you force us to use bitbucket accounts.
fields.summary: Remove the mandatory bitbucket account login

fields.description: Right now, when I inspect changes with keyboard and I decide to add change to commit, I hit ctrl+shifl+plus. But then next change should be selected for inspection. Right now changes (unstaged files section) are unselected so I must use mouse again to select another change.  This makes keyboard support kind of useless as I rather do everything with mouse in current state (but I want to use keyboard in the end)
fields.summary: In working copy view, when I add selected change to the commit, next change should be selected for inspection.

fields.description:
hgflow will create tag name with branch prefix since upgrade to v3.0, such as hotfix/v1.32.3.
Before v3.0, the tag name aways like a version, without branch prefix, such as v1.32.3.

For git repository,  git flow will create tag name without branch prefix on the same SourceTree version.

The command history of SourceTree:
{code:bash}
hg flow -y hotfix finish hotfix/v1.32.3 
warning: tag hotfix/v1.32.3 conflicts with existing branch name
flow: warning: You just specified the <tag-name> using the deprecated syntax:
flow: warning: hg flow <stream> finish <tag-name> [<options>]
flow: warning: Try using the new syntax to do that in the future: hg flow <stream> finish -t <tag-name>
flow: warning: Note that hgflow intentionally forbids finishing a non-workspace branch.
1 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
1 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
(branch merge, don't forget to commit)
3 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
3 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
(branch merge, don't forget to commit)
Completed successfully
{code}
fields.summary: hgflow create tag name with branch prefix, such as hotfix/v1.32.3

fields.description:
When creating a new branch, the checkbox for "Checkout New Branch" has too large an activation area - which means that the slightest mis-pointing outside the "Create Branch" button will untick the checkbox instead.

In the attached screenshot, my pointer was where the arrow is pointing. Please note, the focus at that point is actually on the checkbox.

It's a very benign issue but it's also very irritating as 2-3 times out of 10 I tend to unctick the checkbox by accident.
fields.summary: 'Checkout New Branch' checkbox's focus area is too large

fields.description:
Creating multiple stashes with the same name leads to ordering issues in the Stashes list on the left side pane. It is my understanding that the Stashes list should be ordered with the newest one on top.
 # Make a change and stash the changes, enter a stash message.
 # Make another change and stash the changes, enter the same stash message. The animation of the Stashes list when the stash is added makes it appear as if it is added below the previous one.
 # Clicking on the stashes in the list and observing the diff pane shows the newer stash is on top.
 # Close out the repo view window and then reopen it.
 # Click on the top stash in the Stashes list. The diff pane should show the changes from the newer stash.
 # Wait a few seconds. The highlighted stash will automatically move to the second stash in the list. But the diff pane will still show the changes from the newer stash.
fields.summary: Stashes with the same name causes list ordering issues
Format to Guidlines reformats oddly

fields.description:
If a branch is *deleted* from Bitbucket or Github websites, the deleted branch still shown in Sourcetree desktop application - under Remotes/origin - even if "*Fetch*" is clicked and the application restarted.

While if "Fetch" is done using Github desktop application, it works and reflects on Sourcetree app.
fields.summary: Fetch does not work as expected when a remote branch deleted

fields.description:
Предусловия: установленное приложение "Железнодорожные билеты" через официальный магазин приложений ( Play Маркет для Андроид или Аппстор для IOS)

Шаги к воспроизведению:

1) Запустить предварительно установленное приложения на устройстве Андроид

2) Ввести "Запорожье 1" в поле "Откуда"

3) Ввести "Киев" в поле "Куда"

4) Выбрать "17 января, четверг" в поле "Дата"

5) Выбрать "22:00" в поле "Время с"

6) Нажать кнопку "Поиск поездов"

Ожидаемый результат: Вывод списка поездов по маршруту "Запорожье1 - Киев" с датой 17 января и временем с 22:00. 

Фактический результат: Вывод списка поездов по маршрутам "Новоалексеевка - Киев-Пассажирский" и "Бердянск - Киев-Пассажирский" на дату 17 января и временем с 22:00
fields.summary: При задавании данных маршрута мобильное приложение "Укрзалізниця" выдает некорректные маршруты, которые не соответствуют запросу

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open [http://www.nibulon.com/data]
 # Input values exceeding 100 Виберіть показник вологості, %:

Expected result:  error message 'Index values must not exceed 100' is displayed

Actual result: redundant calculation has been performed
fields.summary: Calculator: No error message when entering numbers more than 100

fields.description:
Quite frequently, a click on any of the items in the sidebar under WORKSPACE, BRANCHES, REMOTES, etc. will be partially ignored. When this happens, the sidebar item is selected but the view is not changed to match.

For instance, clicking on a branch under BRANCHES may select the branch name in the sidebar but not select the branch commit in the history view. Or if the File Status or Search views were previously selected, then history view will not be shown.

Another example is clicking between "File status" or "History" under WORKSPACE. The selected workspace changes in the sidebar, but not in the window.

Because the selection in the sidebar changes, and clicks on the currently selected sidebar item are naturally (and correctly) ignored, when this bug occurs you must click to select some other sidebar item, then click back on the one you really wanted to view. As an example, if I'm in the history view and want to switch to File Status but the click on file status is ignored, then I have to click on, say, a branch name then back on File Status in order to actually switch to the file status view (assuming none of the other clicks are ignored).

There doesn't seem to be much of or any pattern to when sidebar clicks are ignored. This makes it difficult to provide step by step instructions to reproduce. I'll try to record a screencast to demonstrate the issue.

 

This bug combines with SRCTREE-2936 to form a major usability issue for SourceTree. They both interrupt my workflow all the time, to the point that I'm considering moving away from SourceTree after using it for many years (with growing frustration).
fields.summary: Clicks in sidebar are frequently ignored

fields.description: When opening the "Repository Settings" menu the app crashes. This happens for all repositories I have tried so far.
fields.summary: Opening Repository Settings freezes ST

fields.description:
*repo name is not unique*
GitHub is the biggest storage. Too many repositories may have an identical name. So repo name is not enough to use as the local path name.

Example:

I want to use to a different repo

`[https://github.com/mfouquet/Reselect]` and `[https://github.com/reselect/Reselect]`

When I open it in Desktop, local path is `GitHub/Reselect` for both of them.

*Solution*
An option like "Full path for cloning". When the option is enabled, use a local path like `GitHub/mfouquet/Reselect` and `GitHub/reselect/Reselect` respectively.
fields.summary: Cloning repo using full path

fields.description:
There is a Mac graphic editor called Intaglio whose document format is a package (i.e., directory containing hidden files).  In some cases, one of the file is named Icon\r, i.e., it ends with a carriage return character, hex 0D.  (This special name is a Mac convention for putting a custom icon on a folder.)  SourceTree showed this file as an untracked file, but when I tried to have SourceTree delete the file or add it to the repository, it gave error messages saying that it couldn't find any file named "Icon".

Such an Icon\r file can also be created by using the Finder to assign a custom icon to a folder.
fields.summary: SourceTree confused by carriage return in file name

fields.description: The description column in sourcetree is really long, I have to scroll for ages to get to the end of it. In terms of resizing, I can resize it to be even bigger and then down to the current size but the current (very long) size seems to be the minimum.
fields.summary: Description field is too long and not resizable

fields.description:
Replicate Steps:
 # Click on Add Account
 # select Bitbucket server as hosting service
 # mention username which has {{@}} in username. We are using email as username
 # Refresh password with correct password

Issue Message:

Invalid URI: The host name could not be parsed.

 

If you see host name in Authentication tab of options then you will find that, parsing of URL is wrong.

 

It is parsing host with first {{@}} character instead of last {{@}}.

 

This issue is bit critical for us because our whole organisation is not able to use Bitbucket server due to this issue.
fields.summary: Not able to login to bitbucket server with @ in username

fields.description: I group several projects/repos using the "Repository Group" feature. However, I need to go to each of the individual projects to fetch. It'd be very useful if right clicking on the "Repository Group" would allow to fetch for all projects/repos under it
fields.summary: Allow "Fetch" per Repository Group

fields.description:
When trying to expand windows in Sourcetree to better see filenames/paths in the change list and staging area, the window will just control itself and collapse to a thin window that can't be uncollapsed. Restart is required to fix it.

This happens 100% of the time. Your system won't allow me to attach a video.
fields.summary: Sourcetree Window Collapses On Itself

fields.description:
In 2.7.3 in repo browser I see all the private repositories of the organization belong to.

In 3.0.1 I only see my public repos, this makes the remote tab totally unusable for me. Not sure if it is related or not, but the OAUTH token that source tree creates, only asks for " Access public information (read-only)", which seems like it is too little.
fields.summary: Remotes only display public github repos

fields.description:
It will be quite good to have multiple selections how hunks. Because quite often I have a lot of changes in a file but I need to add only some of them. Right know I should tap on each hunk "Stage hunk" and wait until view will reload and do it N-times so it takes a lot of time especially reload view. 

Will be better to have a checkbox on each hunk and when a user selects more than one checkbox the button "Stage hunk" will be "Stage Hunk*s*" and after a tap on it all selected hunks will be on "stage".
fields.summary: Hunk multiple selection

fields.description:
Hi,

The latest version of SourceTree doesnt checkout branch if Option `Check out in SourceTree` is clicked from webpage. 

The function is working well in previous versions and it is occurring after version 3.0.1 is upgraded.
fields.summary: Checkout is not happening from web to desktop app

fields.description:
Preconditions:

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open URL: [http://www.nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Choose "Пшениця класс 1 (гр.А)" in "{color:#505050}Виберіть культуру:{color}" line
 # Choose "Філія "Сватівська" (Луганська обл.)" in "Виберіть базис поставки" line
 # Enter number 45 in "{color:#505050}Виберіть показник вологості, %{color}" line
 # Enter number 67 in "{color:#505050}Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %:{color}" line
 # Press "Розрахувати" button

Expected result: Due to Duval's formula (fact-basis)/(100%-basis) * 100% - 36.05% in {color:#172b4d}"{color}{color:#505050}Виберіть показник вологості, %{color}{color:#172b4d}" line{color} and 66% in {color:#172b4d}"{color}{color:#505050}Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %:{color}{color:#172b4d}" line{color}

Actual result: 0.00% in {color:#172b4d}"{color}{color:#505050}Виберіть показник вологості, %{color}{color:#172b4d}" line, {color}0.00% in {color:#172b4d} {color}{color:#172b4d}"{color}{color:#505050}Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %:{color}{color:#172b4d}" line and Undefined variable error on the top of the page. {color}
fields.summary: Undefined variable error in calculator while entering 45% in "Виберіть показник вологості, %" and  67% in "Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %", choosing " Пшениця 1 класс (гр.А)" and "Філія "Сватівська" (Луганська обл.)"

fields.description:
To reproduce:
 # Start Sourcetree and clear out the "recents" menu by navigating to "File -> Open Recent -> Clear Menu".
 # Open a Git folder via "File -> Open"
 # After the folder window opens, close it using the red close button in the upper left corner of the window.
 # Quit Sourcetree.
 # Start Sourcetree again and navigate to the project window that you just opened via the "File -> Open Recent" menu.  See that nothing happens (no window opened).

Seen on MacOS 10.14.1.
fields.summary: "File -> Open Recent" Menu Doesn't Work

fields.description:
Preconditions:

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open URL: [http://www.nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Choose "Соняшник" in "{color:#505050}Виберіть культуру:{color}" selection form
 # Choose "Перевантажувальний термінал для перевалки зернових та олійних культур (м. Миколаїв)" in "{color:#505050}Виберіть базис поставки:{color}" selection form
 # Enter number 78 in "{color:#505050}Виберіть показник вологості{color}" form and 34 in "{color:#505050}Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки{color}" form
 # Press Button "Розрахунок"

Expected result: 76,09% in "{color:#505050}Знижка по вологості{color}" line and 31.96% in "{color:#505050}Знижка по засміченості{color}" line

Actual result: {color:#172b4d}138.00% in "{color}{color:#505050}Знижка по вологості{color}{color:#172b4d}" line and 31.00% in "{color}{color:#505050}Знижка по засміченості{color}{color:#172b4d}" line{color}
fields.summary: Calculator, invalid discount in "Знижка по вологості" line

fields.description:
Preconditions:

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open URL: [http://www.nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Make sure the page is scrolled up
 # Select and push "{color:#505050}Виберіть базис поставки:{color}" form

{color:#172b4d}Expected result{color}: The whole list will be visible

{color:#172b4d}Actual result: The top of the list is covered by the main page buttons{color}
fields.summary: Calculator, interface bag

fields.description:
Preconditions:

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open URL:[http://www.nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Choose "Соняшник" in "{color:#505050}Виберіть культуру{color}" form

Expected result: 45.65% in "{color:#505050}Знижка по вологості{color}" line and 46.40% in "{color:#505050}Знижка по засміченості{color}" line

Actual result: 42.00{color:#172b4d}% in "{color}{color:#505050}Знижка по вологості{color}{color:#172b4d}" line and 45.00% in "{color}{color:#505050}Знижка по засміченості{color}{color:#172b4d}" line{color}

fields.description:
Preconditions:

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open URL:[http://www.nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Enter number 14 into "{color:#505050}Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %:{color}"  and "{color:#505050}Виберіть показник вологості, %:{color}" lines
 # Press button "Розрахувати"

Expected result: 0% in "{color:#505050}Знижка по вологості{color}" line and 12.24% in "{color:#505050}Знижка по засміченості{color}" line

Actual result: {color:#172b4d}0% in "{color}{color:#505050}Знижка по вологості{color}{color:#172b4d}" line and 12.00% in "{color}{color:#505050}Знижка по засміченості{color}{color:#172b4d}" line{color}
fields.summary: Calculator, incorrect discount in "Знижка по засміченості" line

fields.description:
If I have a many opened tabs the name is cropped in tab title. Will be better to show in main title the name of selected tab of git repository. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Main window title.

fields.description:
Using SourceTree on a Windows machine, with a newly created branch that I have committed code to, I can right-click the branch and choose "Create pull request". It will push the branch to remote and open a PR page on Github for the changes.

On Mac, choosing "Create pull request" does nothing (no action, no message, no error). Once I manually push the branch, then clicking "Create pull request" will open the appropriate Github page.
fields.summary: Create pull request does nothing unless the branch has already been pushed

fields.description:
My .gitconfig is on drive H:. SourceTree resets parts of .gitconfig on start, like:
 * http and https proxy settings
 * diff and merge tool settings

The problem happens on every start of SourceTree v.3.0.12. With the old versions this happened only after SourceTree update.
fields.summary: SourceTree resets parts of .gitconfig on start

fields.description: Please add a "Copy Stash Name to Clipboard" option, just like you have with branch names. I frequently have Jira numbers in the stash description, and copy would make it much easier to look up. Seems easy to add. Thanks.
fields.summary: Add "Copy Stash Name to Clipboard" option, just like with branches

fields.description: If there is a commit, which SHA-1 starts with digits only (14 digits straight for example), this commit cannot be seen in the SourceTree graph and all of the derived commits will start from infinity. I assume that such SHA-1 is treated as a number instead of string.
fields.summary: SourceTree Git show the wrong graph

fields.description:
When trying a PULL, an error message appears, indicating a legacy connection (TLS v1.0). Screenshot in attachments.

The requirements comply for all what is reported in this article for the users of sourcetree and mercurial.

https://bitbucket.org/blog/deprecating-tlsv1-tlsv1-1-2018-12-01?_ga=2.35966752.1202469655.1543834433-691660289.1543834433

Thanks
fields.summary: Pull doesn't work on SourceTree 2.7.6 because of TLS 1.2

fields.description:
Somehow, Sourcetree updated itself to a future, unreleased version.

This completely unintentional. I can't find a way to go back to the stable release from within Sourcetree.

 See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Alpha version, unintentionally updated to Alpha version
[SSL: WRONG_VERSION_NUMBER] wrong version number (_ssl.c:590)

fields.description:
My MacOS Mojave is set to open terminal windows as tabs.
If I've 1 or more tab(s) already open in my terminal app and I click the terminal button on the toolbar, the new tab opens as expected, but the window size of the terminal changes its height to some default value.
fields.summary: Opening a terminal on MacOS Mojave (set to a open in a tab), changes terminal window height

fields.description:
Guys just see how TortoiseHG uses it's search function. It's really sad to open a terminal to perform a search :/

I'm saying like search: user(mycommitname) && keyword(something)

Hence that keyword will search all text, not only commit message

 

I know it's not the same for Github, but would be great to have a way to do it inside SourceTree

 

Keep up with the great work!

Cheers!
fields.summary: Improve Search functionality

fields.description: Since upgrading to SourceTree 3.0, I've seen massive degradation in performance, especially when working with a git repo that has lots (maybe hundreds?) of branches and a long commit history. (It's a work repo with lots of contributors who make temp branches.) It may be not a typical repo, but with 2.x, I wasn't seeing this (as much), and it's made SourceTree almost unusable. It seems like SourceTree is doing a lot of work on the main thread dealing with commit history, and it just hangs the app for long periods of time. Switching from different branches also takes longer, or looking at the history view. I'm not sure what changed but performance has been much worse.
fields.summary: SourceTree shows spinning beach ball for repos with large commit histories
Filter on modified items (Please)

fields.description:
!Screenshot 2018-11-26 at 16.15.09.png!

The file is in UTF-8 encoding, but the umlaut in diff is garbled.
fields.summary: German accented characters not displayed correctly in diff

fields.description:
I'm using SouceTree for Mac and since updating to v3 I am unable to create remote repositories. I receive this error: 

 
{code:java}
message: Not Found
https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#create
{code}
Currently I have to manually create the repo in github and then set it up as the remote.

For reference, I am using the GitHub - OAuth - SSH method for my account and I am trying to create a private repo on a company account that I am admin of.

Again, this worked fine until I updated to v3 and nothing has changed in my system apart from that.
fields.summary: Create Repository Failed

fields.description:
I've got a prompt to write feedback, I started typing, and when I needed to get a new line, I pressed Enter, but the feedback was submitted before I compete writing!

It should be submitted only when I click Submit button, not Enter.

Thanks
fields.summary: Press enter should not submit feedback!

fields.description: Since Bitbucket has a built-in integration with Trello, I wish there will be a tab that integrates/shows linked-*Trello board* directly into Bitbucket... like the way GtiKraken integrates with Glo Boards.
fields.summary: Trello integration for Bitbucket repos

fields.description:
As a keyboard-centric user, I want a direct keyboard shortcut to Show in Finder for a repository, so that I can work as fast as possible and reduce strain from mouse usage.

AC:
 * Keyboard shortcut to Show in Finder - perhaps `ctr+opt+f`?
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut for Show in Finder

fields.description: When initializing GitFlow, if you modify the default prefixes and save, no errors occur, but the modified prefixes are not saved. Viewing the .git/gitconfig confirms the same. If you edit the gitconfig directly, it works as expected.
fields.summary: Modifying Gitflow prefix on initialization doesn't save

fields.description:
Just updated and seeing SourceTree hanging when continuing my rebase.

Manually continued and saw error from GIT:
{code:java}
ME ~/frameworks/go/src/SERVER/SERVICE (detached*)*$ git rebase --continue
/Users/ME/SERVER/SERVICE/.git/rebase-merge/author-script: line 3: unexpected EOF while looking for matching `''
/Users/ME/SERVER/SERVICE/.git/rebase-merge/author-script: line 4: syntax error: unexpected end of file
Error trying to find the author identity to amend commit {code}
When I viewed the author-script I found this:
{code:java}
GIT_AUTHOR_NAME='ME'
GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL='ME@COMPANY.com'
GIT_AUTHOR_DATE='@1540499583 -0700
 {code}
I added a trailing single-quote after the date value and was able to successfully continue through the command-line. The SourceTree GUI did not like that date format workaround, however - only the command-line worked.

I don't know if ST or Embedded-Git or Mac OSX Mojave is at fault - I am guessing ST since I just updated it.
fields.summary: Hang while continue rebase: bad GIT_AUTHOR_DATE format?

fields.description:
The "Check out in Sourcetree" button on a branch in Bitbucket suddenly stopped working for me at least as of version 3.0, same problem in 3.0.1.

When I click the button it opens Sourcetree, but it does not check out the branch. Trying multiple times makes no difference. Restarting Sourcetree does not fix it.

Copying and running the git terminal command provided by Bitbucket still works, as well as switching manually in Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Bitbucket "Check out in Sourcetree" no longer working

fields.description:
There is an error saying "Loading Owners Failed" and there is no way of creating new repositories from SourceTree. After the repo is created from the website and cloned to local everything seems to work fine.

Attached image of the error on this report.
fields.summary: Bug avoids create new repositories on GitHub

fields.description:
Every time I open Sourcetree, it will ask for the password to be used with the Github account configured in it, as if it had never been set up before.

When I check my Mac's Keychain, I cannot find any entry for Sourcetree's Github account password in there.

Note that this issue only applies to the Github account. The password for the Bitbucket account configured in Sourcetree gets properly saved to my Mac's Keychain.
fields.summary: Github credentials not saved
Settings button crash source tree

fields.description:
It's tedious to have to move the mouse to the 'Commit options' pulldown and then select the 'Amend last commit' option for such a common task.

It would *improve the workflow* if especially this option would be part of the layout by default (as a checkbox below the commit message field).
fields.summary: Add 'Amend last commit' as checkbox near the commit message field
Forced to create an account?

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open app "Залізничні квитки".
 # Enter the ruquired data: town, date, time
 # Press "Пошук поїздів"
 #  Select a train
 # Click on the selected ticket
 # Click on the check mark
 # Press button "Оформити"
 # Choose a type of ticket
 # Press "Дитячий"
 # Enter date of birth, name, surname, choose "Послуги"
 # Press button "У кошик"

*Expected result:* message " incorrect date"

*Actual result:* massage "Загальна помилка"
fields.summary: When you enter the wrong birth year when choosing a child's ticket, the message "Загальна помилка" appears

fields.description:
Attempted to "log selected" several dot files: ".htaccess, .gitignore, .env" and got this message:

Potential security issue detected in the specified URL.

Sourcetree determined this URL is in an unspecified format.

The full path to one of the problem files looks like:

/Applications/XAMPP/xamppfiles/htdocs/_experiments/double-front-controller/public/.htaccess
fields.summary: Cannot "Log Selected" some dot files

fields.description:
Under Repository --> Repository Settings, the Security tab is always disabled.

!Screen Shot 2018-11-16 at 5.48.53 PM.png!

I searched for this problem and found a suggestion to set my GPG program under Sourcetree --> Preferences on the Advanced tab, but there are a couple of issues:

 
 # The path currently listed, {{../Cellar/gnupg/2.2.9/bin}}, is in fact valid (assuming Sourcetree is looking in the correct path to use that relative path).
 # Browsing for another path does not permit you to select Mac system folders ({{/usr}}, {{/opt}}, etc.). So I'm unable to point this to my current installation at {{/usr/local/bin}}.
fields.summary: Unable to enable GPG key signing

fields.description: Entering an emoji into a commit message causes the font in the commit message field to change to a different (monospaced?) font for all subsequent commits.
fields.summary: Emojis Break Commit Message Font

fields.description:
I always create patches to merge some changes from one branch to the other.

I follow the following sequence:
 * sync one branch
 * select a commit, and create patch
 * go to another window that represents the other branch
 * select 'apply patch'
 * select the patch file (created above)
 * the window then says 'invalid patch file)

The same sequence always worked in 2.x
fields.summary: 'invalid patch file' when reading created patch file (since SourceTree 3.0)

fields.description:
I selected two commits from different branches, app displays in UI with all changes between  selected commits. But, when i choose create patch option by right click on selected commits, app generates patch file for one of the commit not for the difference files.

If you look at attached images,

Issue: Refer "2-MainBranchCommit" image, i got patch file for main branch commit only.

Expected: I should get patch file for differences. Refer "1-CommitDiffernces" image.

 

Workaround: I added tags to required commits and used command line to generate differences patch file..
{code:java}
git diff tag1 tag2 -- > the-patch.diff{code}
 

Some issues relates in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1099
fields.summary: Patch file does not have all changes when comparing two branches

fields.description:
Today I have done a merge with conflicts. Here an update of a BSP was done where many files have changed. I had about 100 conflicts which i resolved manually.

The automatic commit message created so many lines, that the commit button and the "auto push" tick was moved below the visible area of the screen. Only deleting the commit message brought back the buttons. A Slider or scroll bar for large commit messages would be nice. Or a limit to the maximum number of lines a screen can have.
!image-2018-11-14-10-04-11-609.png!
fields.summary: Too long commit messages move the commit button away

fields.description: After upgrading to macOS Mojave, whenever I right click on the Sourcetree icon and pick one of my repos from the list it does not do anything. If I have any repo open, then right click the dock icon and select a different repo from the list it focuses the currently open repo instead of opening the new repo
fields.summary: Links from macOS Mojave dock icon do not work

fields.description: I have some Problems with the new Gitlab integration. I've filled out the required fields to enable extended Gitlab Integration. But now everytime I wan't to open the Repository Settings the macOS Beachball appears and SourceTree gets stuck.
fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs when opening repository settings

fields.description: I tried to clone a repository from Bitbucket in source tree. It just launches source tree and post that nothing happens. Faced the same issue while checking out a branch as well.
fields.summary: Unable to 'Open in source tree' from Bitbucket
нет сообщения об ошибке приввводе букв вместо цифр в поля индекса

fields.description: click on [repo|x-github-client://openRepo/https://github.com/atlassian/putty-sourcetree-fork] will open the sourcetree without repo.
fields.summary: don't open github links
Калькулятор знижок: Отсутствие сообщения об ошибке при вводе в "показник вологості, %" - буквенные символы, а в "Виберіть показник сміттєвої домішки, %"- цифры
Калькулятор знижок: Отсутствие сообщения об ошибке при вводе "показник вологості, %" - 7;
Калькулятор знижок: Отсутствие сообщения об ошибке при вводе буквенных значений в поля индекса

fields.description:
On SourceTree for Windows while working in a feature branch, I can right-click on the develop or master branch and fetch the latest changes (without having to stash changes, check out, etc).  This functionality is missing from the Mac client, can it be added please?

I work in both environments and it's pretty annoying not to have the same features available.
fields.summary: Add non-active branch fetch like SourceTree Windows has

fields.description: When using Sourcetree with dark mode the cursor in the commit field is black which makes it really difficult to see where it is.
fields.summary: Cursor is black when using dark mode

fields.description:
When trying to upgrade to 3.0.1 from 3.0 (200) via SourceTree -> Check for Updates..., I can select "Install Update", and the update will download and extract.  However, when I click on "Install and Relaunch,", I get a popup with:

 

Update Error!

An error occurred while extracting the archive. Please try again later.

and a "Cancel Update" button.

 

I can't find anything in Console.app that indicates why there was a failure.

 

For some reason (security, likely) I am unauthorized to post a screen shot.
fields.summary: Unable to upgrade to 3.0.1

fields.description:
Since version 3 I am unable to drag a folder from finder to the SourceTree icon in my dock and have the folder open as a repo in SourceTree. 

 

File -> Open Recent also does not work.
fields.summary: Can not drag folder to SourceTree icon in macOS dock
SourceTree v3.0 (200) is Stuck and Will Not Open
Preview WebP's

fields.description:
Hello,

the cursor in the window with the commit text is black. If I change the Sourcetree theme to dark the cursor is still black and is bad to read. White will be better. ;)
fields.summary: Cursor color in dark theme (Commit text)

fields.description:
The following ways to open existing repositories don't work for me:
 * Choosing it from the File > Open Recent submenu
 * Choosing it from the dock icon pop-up (it mirrors Open Recent submenu)
 * Dragging the directory to the SourceTree icon in the dock
 * {{open -a SourceTree path}} in Terminal

These will switch to SourceTree, but won't open any window.

If the repo is already open, it does not switch to its window.

 

It's still possible to open repos in these ways:
 * Choosing File > Open… and navigating to it
 * Double click it from the Repository Browser window
fields.summary: Can't open repositories

fields.description:
Please add Jira integration: in particular, the ability to start a ticket-branch.

For example, when I'm logged in to my Jira space, I should be able to select a ticket assigned to me and create a branch for it (based on the ticket id, with ability to edit it). Bonus points if it also tells Jira that I started working on this ticket.

We use smart commits, so after I push to this branch Jira will take note.
fields.summary: Jira integration
The file status doesn't show any number of changes in files

fields.description:
When accessing a branch in Bitbucket there is a Checkout button which pops a fake modal dialog. Among other things it has a button that says "Check out in Sourcetree". Hitting that button causes the browser to get approval for the page to open SourceTree. Hitting Allow then switches to SourceTree and SourceTree prompts for where to save the branch on the local machine.

After upgrading to 3.0 this all works except the last step. Sourcetree is launched or switched to by the browser but then nothing happens. Switching back to the previous Sourcetree version remedies the issue.

There are other ways to check out a branch but this was handy/convenient when it worked.
fields.summary: Branch checkout from BitBucket web page not transferring to Sourcetree

fields.description:
When running the `stree` command from a folder that contains .git, it no longer opens the repo. It will only open sourcetree and display all your bookmarks.

i.e. no longer does item 3 of expected behaviour as specified in  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1779
fields.summary: stree from commandline does not open bookmark

fields.description: Clone Repository to Bitbucket is not working
fields.summary: Clone Repository to Bitbucket

fields.description:
It appears the spec for "Ignore File Patterns" has changed. Now you have to explicitly specify wildcards, e.g. `*package-lock.json` instead of `package-lock.json`.

Was this documented somewhere? It felt like a silent failure for me.
fields.summary: Diff → Ignore File Patterns Spec Has Changed

fields.description:
Cursor in commit panel is always black - regardless chosen theme.

So its almost invisible in a dark mode.
fields.summary: In dark theme cursor is almost invisible

fields.description: In file status when I want to discard changes I have click on discard file, this is confusing.
fields.summary: Unstaged Files change 'discard file' to 'discard changes'

fields.description:
If there are commitable changes, the commit button in the top left corner reflects the number, but the 'File Status' under Workspace does not display that count anymore. 

On 2.7.4 it works as expected.
fields.summary: Workspace File Status does not reflect the changes

fields.description:
I used to open sourcetree from the command line, with the following command:

/Users/amartoq/some/project $ open -a sourcetree .

This worked really before: even if there was a sourcetree already running, it just opened that git project. But now in version 3.00 it only opens sourcetree, not the project.

I'm not sure, but guess it doesn't open that project neither if a folder is droppped in the git app icon.

 

I need it back, please :)

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Regression: Unable to open sourcetree project from command line (open -a sourcetree folder) on Mac

fields.description:
* Dark theme
 * History view
 * Select a history item
 ** The selected item is displayed with white text on a background color set by your preferences in Mac OS X
 * Move focus to another window
 ** The selected item is displayed with black text on a dark gray background, rendering it illegible
fields.summary: Dark theme: when window is inactive, selected row text becomes illegible black on dark gray

fields.description:
I upgraded to SourceTree 3.0 and installed the new command tools and now stree doesn't open a repository, it just starts the program, which is not useful.

I suppose the symptom severity is minor in that no data is lost, but it's severe enough to keep me from using the program. I have reverted to SourceTree 2.7.6
fields.summary: The stree command no longer opens the repo in 3.0

fields.description:
I have window restoration set to "restore windows on startup", and "keep bookmarks closed on startup" selected.

If I open a repository in SourceTree, and ensure the bookmarks window is closed, then quit and restart SourceTree, it restarts with the repository window _and_ the bookmarks window open. There seems to be no way of stopping the bookmarks window from reopening.

This happens on my personal machine with the specs above, but does _not_ happen on my work machine (iMac (2017) running Mac OS X 10.14.0).

To check for corrupt preferences, I've tried uninstalling SourceTree, removing all preference files, and reinstalling. I had to reset all my preferences, but the behaviour continues.

If I try setting window restoration to "use Mac OS for window restoration", I just get the bookmarks window and the repository window does not reopen.
fields.summary: Bookmarks window always displays at startup regardless of settings
Sanna assignment

fields.description:
Hi,

Before updating Sourcetree to v3.0 approximately a week ago, I used to be able to open a repository via, for example, *{{`stree .`}}*. This would've opened the current directory in Sourcetree, whether the current directory was bookmarked or not.

With v3.0 the same command won't apparently do nothing.

The issue doesn't seem to be related to the relative path either, because if I were to try to open with *{{`stree /Users/me/foobar`}}*, Sourcetree doesn't open the repository just the same.

I think this is a regression that needs to be solved.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Command Line Tools won't open repository

fields.description:
- Commit description text-area: The pointer is black on the black background

- File Change list: text color is pink
fields.summary: There are many issues with dark theme

fields.description: {color:#172b4d}I use Mac OS, when I right-click into Source tree app on the Dock bar to select a my repository in recent item list then there are not any windows are opened{color}
fields.summary: Recent items is not available on Mac OS dock

fields.description:
It was reported as SRCTREE-528 before, reported as resolved, but it still does not work.

It is dead easy to repro with one of Linden Lab's public repositories such as [https://bitbucket.org/lindenlab/viewer-cougar]

Take new commit, paste into Actions > Apply Patch... > Patch Text.

Dry Run button does no work for Modify working copy files.

It also says it is not a valid patch file, even if it came right out of Bitbucket. 

 

!Screen Shot 2018-10-27.jpg!
fields.summary: Still not able to dry run commits pasted into Apply Patch

fields.description:
SourceTree eats 100% CPU and this bug is already reported, bug has the most votes, but it looks nobody cares, maybe because bug is unassigned.

This issue maybe connected to bitbucket-pipelines.yml file in repository is there since 2.7 version.

This unresolved bug has the most votes: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-3172?jql=project%20%3D%20SRCTREE%20AND%20issuetype%20%3D%20Bug%20AND%20resolution%20%3D%20Unresolved%20ORDER%20BY%20votes

But current issue is "unassigned" and duplicated bug is marked "solved"  both are unassigned https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-5318
fields.summary: 100% CPU load

fields.description: Can cold open (no window open for that repo yet) repository in Dock Menu.
fields.summary: Can open repository in Dock Menu

fields.description:
When opening the "push" windows, SourceTree normally has a checkbox selected for a branch.

When switching from the embedded git to the system git, no branch checkbox is selected, when opening the "push" window.

 

Current system git is 2.19.1 but the behavior was also reproducable with latest 2.x SourceTree and older system git versions.
fields.summary: Lost branch selection when using system git instead of embedded git

fields.description:
The diff's background color not correct in version 3.0 (200).

  !not_correct_diff_bg_color.png|thumbnail!

The diff's background color was not same color before

!correct_diff_bg_color.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Diff background color not correct

fields.description: Like in topic. I see SourceTree dark mode almost unreadable. Colors are confusing. Maybe you should change the contrast?
fields.summary: SourceTree dark mode is unreadable
